intro: Dorstenia vermoesenii, commonly known as the "bottle tree," is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its thick, swollen stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Dorstenia vermoesenii is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
